solution_line_template: Mandy paid {promotional_fraction_numerator}/{promotional_fraction_denominator} * {data_plan_charge} = {data_plan_charge} / {promotional_fraction_denominator} = $<<{data_plan_charge}/{promotional_fraction_denominator}={first_month_charge}>>{first_month_charge} for her first month of data.
She paid {data_plan_charge} + {extra_fee} = $<<{data_plan_charge}+{extra_fee}={fourth_month_charge}>>{fourth_month_charge} for her fourth month of data.
Minus those {special_months} months, she had {total_months} - {special_months} = <<{total_months}-{special_months}={regular_charge_months}>>{regular_charge_months} months of regular charges.

Thus, Mandy paid {regular_charge_months} * {data_plan_charge} + {first_month_charge} + {fourth_month_charge} = {regular_charge_total} + {special_months_total} = $<<{regular_charge_months}*{data_plan_charge}+{first_month_charge}+{fourth_month_charge}={total_paid}>>{total_paid} for the first {total_months} months for data.
